alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 07 at 2:27PM MDT until April 09 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR ALL BUT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS ABOVE THE SNOWPACK. STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL EXIST... .A trough moving onto the west coast Saturday will pass to our north Saturday night. Strengthening winds aloft will mix to the surface Saturday, producing breezy to windy conditions, along with very low humidity, above normal temperatures, and a very unstable air mass. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...All Fire Weather Zones except the North Central Mountains above snowpack Saturday afternoon and early evening * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest increasing to 15 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Lowering to 5 to 8 percent. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
